pageContext.claim: “Because [Fentanyl trafficking is] not criminalized. I think [the Chinese] view it as an industrial drug or something. It's not criminalized. And as part of our deal -- and, Bob, don't forget to put that down -- but as part of our deal, I think we're going to get a criminalization of fentanyl being sold into the United States. It'll stop.”
pageContext.analysis: It's misleading to say Fentanyl production "is not criminalized." China does have existing regulations on production and while China has yet to change the criminal designation of Fentanyl, they have put restrictions around many of the chemicals needed to produce it.
